direction.raw_text: Get those pumps working! BATTERY ROOM - A CREWMAN hurriedly flips switches. The lights flicker... And just as they some to life, brightly - THE DOOR BURSTS OPEN, and a wall of water and debris blows in, destroying everything in its wake. THE BRIDGE - Lights out! A sense of helplessness is beginning to fill the room:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The back-up is gone!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Flooding up to B-Deck!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can't hold out much longer, sir! All eyes are on the First Officer. Will he save them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where the hell is the Captain?!?! THE CAPTAIN (PASSAGEWAY #3) - Running, the Captain is about to reach the exit door. Hearing the relentless grinding behind him, he throws a look over his shoulder: BAM! The entrance door EXPLODES in a thunderball of water. The Captain clambers through the exit door to: PASSAGEWAY #4 - A short hall: He shuts the entrance door, runs to the exit. He looks hack again: BAM! The door blasts open - and the torrent of water continues the chase, as if it's got a personal vendetta against him. He exits to: PASSAGEWAY #5 - Slamming the door behind him, the Captain looks ahead, and up: STAIRS. AN OPEN DOOR AT THE TOP. He throws a look back: THE ENTRANCE DOOR IS BEGINNING TO HUM AND VIBRATE. Sprinting for his life, the Captain rushes up the stairs, two at a time. The humming behind him grows louder. He glances back: THE DOOR BLASTS OPEN. WATER SHOOTS IN. He rushes up the last four steps, just as - CA-CHUNK! THE EXIT DOOR SLAMS CLOSED IN FRONT OF HIM! With PANIC IN HIS EYES, the Captain turns to face the oncoming tsunami! We cut to: THE WORM'S POV - (UNDERWATER, INT. PASSAGEWAY #5) Moving like a shark... Toward THE CAPTAIN'S LEGS, DEAD AHEAD IN THE WATER. As it closes in for the kill - THE BRIDGE - Shifts, suddenly, to the stern. A confusion of anxious voices:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slipping to stern!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All major compartments flooded! With all hands still awaiting orders - THE ROOM LURCHES AS THE BOW RISES! Papers fly! Men slide! The First Officer has no choice:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Abandon ship! Break radio silence! Send our position! INSERT - COMPUTER SCREEN - The Communications Officer types: "Top Secret. Indian Ocean Naval Command. H.M.S. Indomitable Sinking."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's our position?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One hundred degrees, thirty-one minutes, and seven seconds East, by two degrees, twenty-nine minutes, ten seconds, North. As he types, the room lurches again, tilting more to the stern. THE CAPTAIN - (STAIRCASE, PASSAGEWAY #5) As the passageway shifts, tilting to the stern, the Captain screams and WHOOSH! - is sucked down into the water - the worm's vortex - like meat being fed into a Cuisinart: A churning, spinning death. EXT. THE H.M.S. INDOMITABLE - FOG - NIGHT Bow rises completely out of the water as the stern goes under. EXT. DECK - TWO CREWMAN manage to get a LIFEBOAT away. TWO OTHERS scramble up from below and leap into the water. WIDER The bow is at a forty-five degree angle... And the H.M.S. Indomitable pauses - for just a moment - before SLIPPING UNDER, STERN FIRST, throwing up a series of great waves. EXT. LIFEBOAT - Rocked by waves from the sinking ship. The Cook, a Marine, and Three Crewmen hear a splash along side. Two of the Crew pull the SONAR OFFICER aboard. He takes a minute to catch his breath, then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Six. That's it? Only six of us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Most of the crew never made it to their life jackets. The Captain?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The First officer stayed on the bridge. One of the CREWMAN SPOTS SOMETHING IN THE DISTANCE:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey - look! Over there! NEW ANGLE - (ROCK OUTCROPPING - STRAIT OF MALACCA - NIGHT) The SEA DOLPHIN II emerges from a cove, looking like a ghostly white apparition in the fog. RETURN ON THE LIFEBOAT - The men yell and wave and whistle, hoping to be saved. CLOSER ON THE SEA DOLPHIN II - DECK - Elliot Harmsway removes a pair of binoculars from his face. Turns to YUNG, standing next to him at the rail:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lovely night for a shipwreck, isn't it? Yung looks at Harmsway like he's crazy. Oblivious, Harmsway looks at his WATCH, then looks through the BINOCULARS again - and begins to WHISTLE the opening notes of My Fair Lady's "WOULDN'T IT BE LOVERLY." ("All I want is a room somewhere, far away from the cold night air") THE LIFEBOAT - As the men cry for help, the Sonar Operator spots something just below the surface, moving toward the lifeboat at great speed. He hears the hum. His eyes follow the churning water... And suddenly - out of nowhere - the Worm hits the lifeboat from below, smashing it to bits, hurtling the pieces in the air. THE SEA DOLPHIN II - Harmsway lowers the binoculars' smiling. Stamper appears, hands Harmsway a piece of paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've decoded their last transmission. Harmsway studies it for a moment - smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perfect. They'll be searching miles from here. (then) Time for phase two. You can get the men in the water. And with this, Harmsway turns, and walks off, jauntily whistling "Wouldn't It Be Loverly." Stamper looks at Yung, re: Harmsway's glee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You heard him. Get the men in the water! NEW ANGLE - SIDE OF THE SEA DOLPHIN II - NIGHT - In the water next to the chip, FOUR DIVERS drop the last of their equipment in a DIVE BOAT. They cast off, motoring into the fog. EXT. LONDON - RESTAURANT BIBENDUM - NIGHT The classic Michelin building on Fulham road. INT. RESTAURANT BIBENDUM - A YOUNG WOMAN is yammering away at Bond; he's trying to put a good face on what is obviously a dreadful fix-up first date.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't believe it took us so long to finally get together! What exactly do you do for the government?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You might say... 'Public relations.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How fascinating! I bet you meet all the most fabulous people. Before Bond can answer, the MAITRE D' interrupts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me - Mr. Bond? You have a call. Bond excuses himself. NEW ANGLE - BOND AT PHONE - 007 picks up the receiver, without saying hello:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Moneypenny! You're early. You weren't supposed to call until - (he stiffens) Yes. I understand. Twenty minutes. EXT. THE BANK OF LONDON - NIGHT Passing a NEWSPAPER DELIVERY TRUCK with an ad for "TOMORROW" ("The Paper that Never Lies,") Bond's DB-5 roars past the guard. INT. CONFERENCE ROOM - BANK OF LONDON - NIGHT ADMIRAL ROEBUCK glares as MINISTER JOHNSTONE enters to address M, TANNER, A TREASURY OFFICIAL, and various UNIFORMS and SUITS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good evening. I've just spoken with the Prime Minister at the economic summit in Tokyo; he's expecting a full update within the hour. (beat) For those of you still unaware, some forty minutes ago -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, but - (all turn to him:) I must formally protest this meeting. Given the nature of what's occurred - and the need for secrecy - I see no reason to involve the air force, the army, or MI-6. (beat, as M and Tanner exchange a look) This is an internal affair that should be handled strictly by the officers of her Majesty's Royal Navy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Admiral, are you suggesting - He's distracted by the CLICK OF A DOOR OPENING. All turn to SEE BOND entering, wearing a FULL NAVAL UNIFORM. M stifles a smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry I'm late - M Actually, you're just in time. (she turns to) Admiral Roebuck: You know Commander Bond, don't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Of course.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've looked forward to meeting you. Bond sits. M glances at Johnstone as if to say "proceed."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As I was saying: Approximately forty- five minutes ago, we received an abandon ship signal from the H.M.S. Indomitable. (flicks on a map display) Looking at these infrared satellite images - provided by Mr. Tanner of
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THE WORM STREAKS TOWARD THE INDOMITABLE,
HEAR A HIGH-PITCHED WHINING, GRINDING SOUND
THREE FOOT SECTION OF THE DECK EXPLODES IN A FOUNTAIN OF WATER
AN OPEN DOOR AT THE TOP
THE ENTRANCE DOOR IS BEGINNING TO HUM AND VIBRATE
THE CAPTAIN'S LEGS, DEAD AHEAD IN THE WATER
THE ROOM LURCHES AS THE BOW RISES
CREWMAN SPOTS SOMETHING IN THE DISTANCE

direction.raw_text: -the ship is presumed lost here, just south of Kuala Lumpur, where she broadcast her last position.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. STRAIT OF MALACCA - FOG - NIGHT Foreground, empty diving boat. Background, Sea Dolphin II, with the "flexible hose" hanging over the rail, down into the water. INT. BRIDGE - SEA DOLPHIN II - NIGHT Stamper works "worm" master control with a video joystick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Divers approaching the hull. Harmsway and Yung look over his shoulder at: INSERT - VIDEO SCREEN - Through the worm's UNDERWATER camera, FOUR DIVERS with TORCHES and WELDING TOOLS are about to enter the HOLE in the Indomitable's hull. (The video screen also contains lots of digital information about the divers and the worm's functions.) NEUTRAL POV - UNDERWATER - EXT. INDOMITABLE The worm follows the Divers into the hull. WORM POV - INT. ENGINE ROOM - It trails the Divers past debris and bodies of crewman. SAME SHOT - VIDEO SCREEN - WORM POV - HARMSWAY (O.S.) (into microphone) To the right, towards the stern. The Divers react, and the worm follows them into... PASSAGEWAY - UNDERWATER - NEUTRAL POV - INT. INDOMITABLE - The Divers and worm travel to a HATCH COVERED WITH METAL BARS. Lighting the welding torches, they try to cut through the metal bars... Unsuccessfully. VIDEO SCREEN - WORM POV - One of the Divers turns to the worm's camera. He SPEAKS into his diving helmet's microphone:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's titanium. we can't cut through. INT. SEA DOLPHIN BRIDGE - Stamper turns to Harmsway:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Divers, stand aside. NEUTRAL POV - UNDERWATER - PASSAGEWAY - The worm moves into position to grind through the hatch. A protective cover slides over the lens, and the grinder whorls into life. CLOSER ON THE WORM - The grinder stalls for an instant as it encounters the titanium bars. STILL CLOSER - One of the URANIUM GRINDING TEETH SNAPS OFF as it hits the titanium, and starts to grind through. NEW ANGLE Once past the bars, the grinder cuts easily through the steel door. Trapped air bursts out from inside the compartment. The Divers push the worm to one side; two of them enter the hold with lights. The worm follows. The two other divers remain behind to feed the worm's flexible tubing through the door. INT. BILGE HOLD - UNDERWATER - The Divers' lights illuminate the hold: STACKS OF GOLD BARS, as far as the eye can see. INT. BRIDGE - SEA DOLPHIN II - Harmsway looks at the video screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gentlemen: I do believe we've struck gold... Four minutes ahead of schedule. INT. BILGE HOLD - UNDERWATER - The worm closes its "eye", revs up its grinders, and attacks the first pile of gold Bars. It runs through them like butter. INT. CONFERENCE ROOM - BANK OF ENGLAND - NIGHT The bloodletting and recriminations have begun. This plays fast:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One-third of the British gold reserves?!? (beat) What kind of idiot loses - (looks to the treasury officer) What is it? The equivalent of ten billion US dollars???
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give or take. Depending on today's currency rates -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell was the gold doing on that boat?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We were bringing it back from Hong Kong. Under orders from the Treasury.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: During the cold war, we stored a third in America, and another third in Hong Kong - in case of a nuclear attack. And with the turn-over of Hong Kong to the Chinese -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why wasn't the ship protected?!?! Why was it sailing without radar?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I resent your tone, sir. I have men who are missing -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I have the entire British economy to worry about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Minister - (all turn to him) Obviously, MI-6 was not involved in this operation. But I have to defend the Admiral. Roebuck looks at Bond with great surprise. Bond continues:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Electronic silence was the safest way to move that gold. Otherwise, any country - or individual - with the crudest missile could just lock onto our signals, and take out the boat. (beat) That's what happened to the Sheffield in the Falklands. (beat) Since then, it's standard operating procedure for any sensitive shipment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At least we know where the gold is. When are the recovery ships due?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hours. They've already sailed from the Persian gulf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I expect to have that gold recovered in 36 hours. Until then, I'm imposing my own electronic silence: For the sake of the economy, not a word to NATO, the press, the CIA. (beat, looking at:) ...And so long as Commander Bond here seems to be such an expert on these matters, I want him to go along as an observer. Are we agreed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. M As you wish. EXT. SEA DOLPHIN II - NIGHT Harmsway walks along the side of the ship, observing the operation: The WORM'S DREDGING PUMP sucks up the ground-up GOLD AND WATER SLUR- RY, (through the TUBE hanging over the side,) and dumps it into a SERIES OF SLUICES. At each stage the gold nuggets fall to the bottom of the sluice, and excess water flows off the side of the ship. AT THE STERN HOLD - where all the water has been drained off, leaving a cascade of gold nuggets pouring into the ship's hold - HARMSWAY reaches into the shimmering cascade, and takes a hand-full of gold. He sees Stamper approaching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Remember the golden rule, Mr. Stamper: He who has the gold, rules. He drops the gold back in the hold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is the helicopter ready?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fueled and waiting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. We have an appointment in Hong Kong. INT. HALLWAY - BANK OF LONDON - NIGHT - M and Bond, striding down a hallway to exit the building. M ...You're turning into quite the politician, 007.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have an excellent teacher. (sideways glance) 'Make sure you wear the uniform'? M (ignoring his jibe) What do you make of all this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It doesn't quite add up. They've come to a door. Pause as he opens it. He explains:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The infrared satellite images. No heat, no flame, no explosion. If that boat went down where they said it did, there should have been some residual heat reading on the surface. M Sabotage?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A three-thousand ton frigate doesn't just vanish into thin air. She nods and pushes through the door. He follows. EXT. BANK OF LONDON - NIGHT - CONTINUOUS - M I've already contacted our station in Kuala Lumpur. They're lining up a local contact. (beat) I want you to find that gold, and secure it. They've arrived at her car. The door is already open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Didn't Elliot Harmsway just move his headquarters to Kuala Lumpur? She turns, freezes Bond with a look: M Contrary to what you may believe,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the world is not filled with mad-men who can hollow out volcanoes, stock them with big-breasted women, and threaten the world with nuclear annihilation. Bond reacts to the comeuppance. She continues: M (cont'd) The case is closed. The Italian authorities ruled the girl a suicide. We had enough trouble keeping your name out of the media. For everyone's sake - (beat) Your job is to find the gold. Not settle some personal score with Elliot Harmsway. EXT. 'HARMSWAY BUILDING' (HONG KONG AND SHANGHAI BANK) - HONG KONG - DUSK Super: HONG KONG. Harmsway's helicopter is perched atop the famous tinker-toy-styled building in the Central district. INT. PENTHOUSE BOARDROOM - DUSK A CHINESE CHOP comes down firmly on a legal document. GENERAL LI (of the People's Revolutionary Army) is seated with a squad of lawyers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that is the fifth document. With your counter-signature, the sale will be complete. The document is passed across to HARMSWAY, sitting with his own legal counsel. One of the men is WHISPERING TO HIM, INTENSELY:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure? If we waited - Harmsway waves the lawyer off, silencing him. Addresses the General:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: General Li: My young associate here has just informed me that if I waited a year, I could perhaps receive a higher price for this building. (beat, wryly) He has great faith in Hong Kong. As did my ancestors. With obvious results. Nervous chuckles around the table, but the General is reserved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yet to sell this building for more money - to profiteer - would run counter to the Chinese sprit of guanchi - mutual trust and obligation; it would violate the ancient principles of feng shui - (beat) - the reason we sign five documents instead of an unlucky four, and why this building has a fifth, non-functioning ventilation shaft on its roof. (beat) Wind and water, fire and rain, earth and sky - feng shui. All things - at one, in balance, with nature.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Most eloquently put, Sir Elliot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, General Li. Now I'll just sign this last document - He puts the pen to the paper, and BREAKS THE PEN. Alarmed looks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Terribly sorry. Mr. Stamper? From behind, Stamper hands him a pen. Harmsway innocently starts to sign in RED INK -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir Elliot! Red ink -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course! How foolish. More bad luck. I'll just borrow yours - He takes General Li's pen, and signs his name with a flourish. EXT. ROOF OF 'HARMSWAY BUILDING' - Under the whirring blades of the chopper, Harmsway bids farewell to General Li. He and Stamper get in helicopter. CLOSE ON THE HELICOPTER - As Harmsway waves good-bye from the window, the helicopter rises, REVEALING a METAL CABLE attached to the LANDING SKID. WIDER - The cable leads to a spool, which runs to the FIFTH METAL VENTILATION SHAFT Harmsway referred to in the last scene. INT. HELICOPTER - AIRBORNE - Harmsway pops open a bottle of champagne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An old Chinese toast to our friends... RETURN ON ROOFTOP HELIPAD - The General SEES THE CABLE GROW TAUT AROUND THE VENTILATION SHAFT. He reacts with horror. INT. HELICOPTER/HARMSWAY ROOFTOP POV - Harmsway glances down to watch the VENTILATION SHAFT TOPPLE onto the General and his aides, scattering them like rats. In the chopper, the pilot cuts the cable, and Harmsway lifts a champagne glass:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Confusion to the enemy. In 48 hours, that building - and all of Hong Kong around it - will cease to exist. AERIAL - SKIES ABOVE STRAIT OF MALACCA - DAY - A BRITISH MILITARY C-130 airship is dropping sono-buoys into the water from a low altitude. me plane veers off, revealing A BRITISH SEA KING command and control helicopter, hovering above. INT. SEA KING HELICOPTER - AIRBORNE - DAY Bond holds a map of the channel. He's standing over several CREWMAN seated at radar, sonar, and navigation consoles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sounding: Bottom is thirty fathoms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing. Negative bounce.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We should be right over it. They hear a SHARP DINGING SOUND -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait - I'm getting something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where? What is it? The man points at one of the screens, where Bond sees a COMPUTER GENERATED MAP OF THE SEA FLOOR, with the FAINT OUTLINE of a WARSHIP.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not sure yet - He types in some commands on a keyboard, and a 3-D rendering of a boat appears on another computer screen. Lots of data:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Shinjuku. Japanese troop carrier. World War II.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's make another pass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have traffic on the deck - They look down and see an HNN (Harmsway News Network) boat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get rid of them. NEW ANGLE - EXT. SEA RING CHOPPER & HNN BOAT - The chopper hovers above the HNN boat -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please leave the area. please leave the area. EXT. HNN WORLD HEADQUARTERS (PETRONAS TOWERS)- KUALA LUMPUR - DAY We're looking up at the world's tallest building: The 1500' twin Petronas Towers. (They look like an architectural collaboration between Friz Lang and H.G. Wells.) At the 50th floor, there's a sky bridge connecting the buildings, where - INT. SKY BRIDGE - (HNN HEADQUARTERS) - DAY Elliot Harmsway strides out of an elevator (in Tower 1,) into a group of waiting assistants. Without breaking stride -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good morning Sir Elliot! Welcome to Kuala Lumpur -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morning, morning all. What have we got? His EXECUTIVE SECRETARY rushes to keep up, reading from a pad, as they cross the sky bridge to HNN's main reception area, in Tower 2:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Canadian Prime Minister wants to set a lunch -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pencil it in for the next trip -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The American presidential candidate called to complain about that sex story -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Send him a $10,000 campaign contribution, and explain I have no control over what my journalists write -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your bankers want an answer about the Brazilian TV stations
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Queen invited you to dinner -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the 9:30 news meeting is waiting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excellent. They've passed from the bridge, through reception, into: INT. CONFERENCE ROOM - HNN HEADQUARTERS - CONTINUOUS - DAY A glass conference roam, whose PARTIALLY CLOSED BLINDS obscure the view of the MAMMOTH HNN NEWS CENTER. (We'll see this, in full, later.) Meanwhile, a DOZEN RAMBUNCTIOUS EDITORS react to:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morning, all my golden retrievers. What kind of havoc shall we create in the world today?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - A ferry sank and burned in Pakistan; 457 dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: American jetliner down in Omaha -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Economic summit ends in Tokyo -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boring -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Riots broke out at the World Cup soccer finals -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dog bites man. (explains) Man bites dog is a news story. Riots at the World Cup soccer finals is a social announcement. Next?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This just came in: There's something up with the British Navy in the Strait. Rescue planes, helicopters; two ships supposedly sailing from the Persian gulf. They just chased away one of our news boats.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that so?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Sounds like a plane went down or something... Either way, they're calling it - all together now:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: routine training exercise."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm shocked!! Issue the usual vehement protest: Freedom of the press, people's right to know... Lather it up with a lot of righteous indignation. (off their laughter) Next? INT. SEA KING HELICOPTER - AIRBORNE - DAY Frowning, Bond peers at the Sonar Operator's screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still nothing? The operator shakes his head. The pilot calls back from the cockpit:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Commander Bond: They've found one of the crewman's bodies! EXT. COASTAL INLET - MARSHLAND - STRAIT OF MALACCA - DAY The Sea King comes in above several police cars and boats. Bond jumps the last ten feet, and the chopper peels off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yo! Jimbo! Bond turns to look: It's JACK WADE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wade, what the hell are you doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am not here, ol' buddy. The CIA has absolutely no knowledge of the missing ship, the missing gold, where it was going, or when it left Hong Kong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's reassuring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey - the world is my office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's take a look at the body. As Bond moves off, WADE SNIFFS THE AIR, savoring the aroma:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smells like... Coffee plants. NEW ANGLE - A POLICEMEN pulls a white sheet from the body. (We don't see it.) Bond and Wade look down at something gruesome:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colorful... Shark attack? Bond shakes his head grimly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think so. The veins are cauterized - as if they were sealed by heat... (beat, confounded) But there are no burn marks on the flesh. It doesn't make sense. (to the policeman) Who found the body?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dato. Local fisherman. Says it came in with the tide early this morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ask him if it could have washed in from the west side of the Strait. The POLICEMAN has an animated conversation with FISHERMAN. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. He says it's not possible. The current could have only brought the body in from the east.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have a boat?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know if you'd call it a boat...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something with an engine? Not oars?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Step into my office. EXT. 'THE RUNNING DOG' CIGARETTE BOAT - STRAIT OF MALACCA - DAY - Smashing through the water at breakneck speed. Wade and Bond yell over the engines.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want with the Harbor Master?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tide and current charts. Work backward from the body - find where the ship sank. (Wade nods appreciatively) Where did you get the boat?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seized it from a guy smuggling computer chips out of Bangkok. (beat) Should have seen his rose garden: Blooms the size of hand grenades. Bond looks at Wade: The man remains, forever deranged. EXT. PORT KLANG - ESTABLISHING - DAY The Harbor Master's tower overlooks a small armada of yachts, fishing boats, etc. A series of long dockways jut out into the harbor. CIGARETTE BOAT - (PORT KLANG - WATERWAY) - DAY Wade's boat is moving slowly along the waterway at the end of the docks. Looking off, Bond spots the Harbor Master's Tower:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Over there. Wade turns the boat down one of the dock channels. NEW ANGLE - WADE/BOND'S POV - DOCKWAY CHANNEL - A SLEEK LAUNCH is ROARING TOWARDS them, on a dead collision course. A WOMAN in a baseball cap is at the wheel. WADE pulls his boat to the right; the LAUNCH ROARS AROUND THEM, rocking the cigarette boat with its wake. BOTH BOND and WADE clock the woman - who we will later learn is SIDNEY WINCH. Wade stares after her:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I've just seen my next future ex-wife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not if you kill us first - unless that's how you plan to leave Muffy. Wade scowls, setting the boat back on course. DOCKSIDE - PORT KLANG - DAY - Bond hops off the boat, securing the lines. Wade joins him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By the way, Jimbo - whatever happened to that girl - in Cuba - ? Finished tying the boat, they walk toward the Harbor Master's office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Natalya?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Russian Minister of Transportation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She married a hockey player.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I envy your 'undercover' assignments.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We work in the dark. We do what we can. INT. HARBOR MASTER OFFICE - PORT KLANG - DAY The local Malay harbor master puts a stack of charts on the counter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wind, tide, currents... You're the second person today asked for a full set of charts. (holds out a clipboard) If you'd just sign here - Bond takes the clipboard - INSERT CLIPBOARD - read signature: SIDNEY WINCH. Bond returns the clipboard:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. (apparent afterthought) By the way - was there anything strange the night before last? Odd weather, lost boats - ??
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... Unless you're talking about the bus problem.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Bus problem?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain Cheong's ferry was late. He runs the line across the Strait between here and Sumatra. The lumber mill workers coming back for the weekend missed the last bus. Slept on the docks. Hundreds of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. EXT. HARBOR MASTER'S TOWER - DAY Bond emerges, carrying the charts, along with Wade.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to get these to London. Do you know this Captain Cheong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spends his nights at the Kuala Lumpur yacht club.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you arrange a meeting?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell. The CIA built that club. EXT. KUALA LUMPUR YACHT CLUB - NIGHT Palm trees, torch lights, and Rolls Royces. INT. KUALA LUMPUR YACHT CLUB - NIGHT A local band plays on the verandah. We find Wade at a POKER TABLE with five local Malay Chinese. He CUTS THE CARDS, exuberantly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay gentlemen. The name of the game is 7-card Cambodian stud. Everything is wild! And then - moving through a beaded glass curtain - we find Bond, in a white dinner jacket, sitting with CAPTAIN CHEONG. The Captain is elegant, mid-5O's, eye patch. (To be put into local dialect.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the Strait of Malacca, when a boat is even five minutes late, one begins to worry, Mr. Bond.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. Pirates from Sumatra want the cargo; smugglers from Thailand and Burma want the ships.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sometimes kill the crew; other times - (points to his eye) Torture them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Kuala Lumpur ferry was 35 miles off-course that night. Captain blamed the auto-pilot; I suspected he was drunk - until the Sumatra ferry captain had same problem.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you test the auto-pilots? The satellite positioning receiver?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Next morning. Both boats. Nothing wrong. (chuckles) My 90 year old grandfather thinks 'Ghost in the computer - Silicon Dragon.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I appreciate your time -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe you should talk to Sidney Winch. Owns a marine salvage company. Nobody knows more about the Strait.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where can I find him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Him? He, is a she - (points) at the bar. NEW ANGLE - THE BAR - SIDNEY WINCH, about 32, tough, smart, and (here's a surprise,) beautiful, is ordering a drink when Bond appears:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bourbon. Neat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wonder if you handle your liquor more carefully than you handle your boat. Very slowly, Sidney turns to Bond. She looks him up and down - as if deciding whether this specimen is worth her time. Her conclusion: A definite - though skeptical - maybe. She gives him a sultry smile:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sometimes, you just have to plunge into things. Be reckless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - And I bet you always leave turmoil in your wake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have we met?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This afternoon. Our boats practically kissed in the harbor. (holds out his hand to shake) James Bond.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sidney Winch. The BARTENDER APPEARS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vodka martini, shaken not stirred. (to Sidney) And another for you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. But you can buy a drink for my friend, Taro. She steps back REVEALING a huge SAMOAN, TARO, wearing a dark suit and tie, sitting on a stool. Taro smiles menacingly at Bond.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boyfriend?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chaperone. I'm waiting for my dinner date.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pity. (to Bartender) Bring him whatever he wants.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what brings you to Kuala Lumpur, Mr. Bond? (beat) Wait - don't tell me: Unhappy marriage? Running from some poor little girl with two kids and a Chanel pocketbook in - London? Bond analyzes the situation: 1) She's with a thug. 2) She's in marine salvage. 3) She went to the Harbor Master's office for the charts. 4) She's a smart-ass. He decides to see if he can rattle her:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually, I'm here on business. You might say it was a... Golden opportunity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And exactly what business are you in, Mr. Bond?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Insurance. Lloyds of London.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Strait can be a very dangerous place, Mr. Bond. A few words scribbled on a piece of paper in London doesn't carry a lot of value out here. Including life insurance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll keep that in mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see my date is here. (to Taro) And I think Mr. Bond is ready to leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice to run into you again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's not make it a habit. She exits. Turning his back on Taro, Bond watches her cross the room. Taro places a huge hand on Bond's shoulder -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you should go -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not quite yet, Taro - And from BOND'S POV - Sidney greets HARMSWAY with a big hug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uncle Elliot!! Watching this, Bond seethes with memory of Paris and his hatred of Harmsway. Taro tightens his grip -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said you should - But before he finishes, Bond spins, and: 1) slams Taro's head on the bar, 2) snatches the ice-pick from the bartender, 3) yanks Taro back- ward by his collar, 4) slams the ice-pick through Taro's tie into the wooden bar, and 5) kicks the stool out from under the goon. Taro is now hanging by his tie, from the bar, choking. Bond takes a moment to straighten his own bow-tie. Wade appears, jubilant, with a wad of cash:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yo! Jimbo! I won five hundred - (seeing Taro) What happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He tied one on. EXT. A DESERTED MARINA - MORNING - Bond walks down a long dock towards a lone boat, moored at the end. EXT./INT. BOAT AT MARINA - MORNING - Bond looks around furtively, before climbing aboard the sleek ocean- going craft. On the aft-deck, there's a large covered object. As Bond reaches for the CABIN DOOR, it opens by itself - and a succession of THREE YOUNG ENGLISH WOMEN in STRING BIKINIS emerge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good morning!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's arrived. Bond turns from the door to watch the women. He hears:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're late 007. I've been expecting you. Q emerges from the cabin in a blazer and an ascot. He's irritated:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! How are you? Q Retired. I'm not getting paid to help you save the world anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. It was a national emergency - Q That hardly makes up for the imposition. (beat) Now, for what I hope will be the very last time - pay attention, 007. (he unfurls a map:) First, computer generated retrograde analysis map. Body here, meteorolog- ical influences here, likely vector- ing of the ship's coordinates here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have any idea of what any of that means? In English? Q Not a clue. I didn't lose the ship. (reaches for a Filofax sized device) Next, your new personal communicator. (flips it open) Picture-phone, fax, beeper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do I have to dial '9' to get out? Q I don't care who you dial, so long as it's not me. Next - Q walks to the large object on the aft-deck. Pulls off a tarp: Q Your new car. (Insert name)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Four wheel drive? Q Yes. And do try to keep all four of them on the road. (continuing) All the usual refinements: Smoke, missiles, machine guns - (shows him a key fob) Fully operational remote control. Drives forward, reverse - (Bond presses a button, opening a window) Stop that! (grabbing it away) Plus infrared thermal imaging radar, heads up instrumentation, and 17 beverage cup holders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... 17 Beverage cup holders? Q Standard equipment. The world's automobile manufacturers seem to be in some kind of mad war to see who can provide the most beverage cup holders. Bond nods, and LOOKS AT a distraction from the GIRLS IN BIKINIS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I must say, Q, you seem to be doing rather well in your retirement. Q Don't even think about it. 007. They're my granddaughters. STRAIT OF MALACCA - DAY - Clear skies and blue water. The only vessel in sight is a thirty- five foot SPORT FISHING BOAT underway at full throttle. EXT. SPORT FISHING BOAT, FLYING BRIDGE - DAY - Wade at the helm; Bond next to him, near sonar, holding Q's map.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slow down. We're close. Wade pulls back on the throttle. AERIAL - (SPORT FISHING BOAT/STRAIT OF MALACCA) - DAY - The boat starts a wide turn - NEW ANGLE - (SPORT FISHING BOAT/ROCK OUTCROPPING/STRAIT) - DAY - And we're back at the outcropping where the Indomitable sank. The SPORT FISHING BOAT is trolling against a background of sandy beaches and the lush green hills of Sumatra. FLYING BRIDGE - Wade scans the shore; Bond studies the sonar display.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dunno, Jimbo. It can't be out here. How could they get this far off course?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who knows? Fog, night...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They'd never sail this close to the shore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait a minute - (beat, pointing to the screen) I've got it. There! Off the port bow! INSERT SONAR SCREEN - The murky electronic outline of a ship. BACK TO SCENE - Bond watches the sonar screen. Wade slows engines, consults charts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cut the engines! It's about two- hundred fifty feet down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : AN ANCHOR BEING PITCHED INTO THE WATER - (BOW OF SPORT FISHING BOAT) - By Wade. Bond is strapping on his scuba tank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two-fifty's pretty deep for air. You should really be using mixed gases. Bond glances at the air gauge on his tanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll make a bounce dive. If I can keep my bottom time short, I'll be all right. Bond gathers up FLARES, and sits on the gunwale.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep your eye out for pirates. Wade pulls back his shirt to reveal TWO SIX-SHOOTERS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got you covered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's reassuring. Bond rolls backward into the water and disappears. UNDERWATER - Bond swims to the anchor line, and begins pulling himself downward, handover-hand, deeper and deeper into a monochromatic gloom. UNDERWATER BOTTOM - Bond touches down by the anchor; his fins kick up the sandy bottom. Checking his wrist compass, he sets off through a rocky channel. EXT. INDOMITABLE - UNDERWATER - Ahead, in the dimness, a huge gray shape looms out of the sand. Bond lights a FLARE, and the scene is suddenly alive with color. From Bond's position, the hull seems to go on forever before being lost beyond range of his flare. Bond checks his air gauge. INSERT GAUGES - Depth: 283 feet - Air capacity: 3/4 tank remaining. BACK TO SCENE - Bond swims to the hole in the side of the Indomitable. He pauses to study the damage. Then enters. INT. ENGINE ROOM - UNDERWATER - Bond sees the damage on the passageway door. Swims through it. INT. PASSAGEWAY - UNDER WATER - The flare throws eerie shadows along the corridor; Bond swims to the busted bilge-hold hatch. Again, he pauses to examine the marks made by the worm. He drops into the hold. INT. CARGO HOLD - UNDER WATER - The gold is gone. Bond swims a few yards in: Nothing. A vast empty space. Bond's flare sputters and dies. He drops it, lights another. As he turns to exit, SOMETHING GLINTS on the deck below the hatch. He moves toward it. NEW ANGLE - CLOSER - A half-chewed GOLD BAR is wedged between a brace and the bulkhead. Bond reaches for it, feeling the worm's drill marks on the gold. Just as he yanks the bar out, a MORAY EEL lashes out from behind the brace, baring its teeth. Still clutching the gold bar, Bond jumps back, and shoots up, into: PASSAGE WAY -(INT. INDOMITABLE) - UNDER WATER - where he collides with something floating just below the ceiling. Dropping the flare on the impact, Bond twists around to see: THE FACE OF A FLOATING DEAD SAILOR. BACK TO SCENE - Throwing wildly gyrating shadows, the flare drops to the deck, roll- ing under some debris. Regaining his composure, Bond SLIPS THE GOLD BAR INTO A WEBBED SACK ON HIS BELT, then moves to retrieve the flare. CLOSE ON HATCH/DECK - Bond reaches for the flare, under a section of the torn hatch cover. He notices the BROKEN URANIUM GRINDING TOOTH. He picks it up, stuffs it into his sack, and swims off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : UNDERWATER BOTTOM - ANCHOR - Bond swims to the anchor line, grabs hold, and starts up. On the way, he glances at his gauges: INSERT GAUGES - Depth: 160 feet - Air capacity: below RED LINE - empty. The ambient light level on the gauges suddenly DARKENS. BOND LOOKS UP TO THE SURFACE - HIS POV - A black HULL has blotted out the light... And SOMETHING LARGE AND HEAVY IS FALLING straight at 007. BOND - kicks away from the anchor-line just as a 1000 POUND ANCHOR streaks by. He looks up again: THREE DIVERS ARE IN THE WATER. One carries a strange-looking HARPOON-TYPE GUN; another trails a CABLE. The divers have fanned out, looking for 007. BOND - Realizes his best chance is to take one of the men hostage. Flashing his KNIFE, Bond cuts the cord to his gold/uranium sack, STUFFS THE SACK INTO HIS BAGGY SWIM TRUNKS. Bond rockets up, SLAMMING INTO DIVER #1. A confusion of bubbles. And just as Bond overcomes the man - spinning him around, holding the knife to the diver's throat - DIVER #2 SHOOTS the HARPOON-TYPE GUN, and A DOLPHIN NET explodes out, ENVELOPING BOND AND THE DIVER in a mesh. (Note: This is a real, 'fish friendly' research tool.) Diver #3 HOOKS THE CABLE he's been trailing onto the net, and - EXT. SEA - The net erupts through the surface, is hauled up into the air, and deposited on - THE DECK OF A SELF-PROPELLED SALVAGE BARGE. (An old scow, with a large crane, two-story deck-house, and a crew whose idea of 'cruise-wear' runs to tattoos and grotesque scars. BOND'S POV - THROUGH HIS DIVING MASK - As the water drains from his mask, Bond sees the mesh being pulled away, and FIVE GOONS come into focus, training AUTOMATIC WEAPONS on him. (Bond still has the diver from behind, knife to his throat.) One of the goons reaches forward, ripping off Bond's mask. 007 sees: TARO - (EXT. SALVAGE BARGE, DECK) - Brandishing an UZI at Bond, with a malevolent smile:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uzi beats knife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Interesting point. Bond sticks the knife into the deck, and releases the hostage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get him up. Take his belt. (motioning to Wade) Take the two of them to the Captain. The men grab Bond roughly, and shove him next to Wade.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By the way. I almost forgot. (smashing Bond) I owed you one. Bond and Wade are frog-marched to the bridge, passing under the gaze of various cutthroat crew members. Wade is completely unfazed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smell that Jimmy? Sea Kelp. Bond gives Wade a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey - it could be worse. At least they speak English. Bond glances up at a crew member, SHARPENING A MACHETE, smiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Somehow, that's not reassuring. INT. BRIDGE - SALVAGE BARGE - DAY We're back in Bond-land: A high-tech control room, with lots of monitors and white-suited TECHNICIANS. Bond and Wade are pushed through the-door, followed by Taro and the two goons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here they are, Captain. The "Captain" turns from a monitor: IT'S SIDNEY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just give me one goad reason - Mister Bond, from Lloyds of London - why I shouldn't kill both of you, burn your boat, and use your bodies for shark bait.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you two know each other!?! Small world, ain't it? What happened? Commitment problems?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sidney Winch, meet -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack Wade. Citibank. Commercial loan division. If you're ever lookin' for a sweet refinance on the boat -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Shut up!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to excuse Miss Winch: She thinks she's on a 'seduce and destroy' mission through life... (pauses) ...But she won't kill us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. First, because I don't think it's in your nature. And second, because there's no gold down there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So charming! So suave! (beat) Don't insult me. I'm not one of your 'little London girls' who falls for the lies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So it was commitment!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Every wharf-rat from here to Hong Kong knows what's on that boat and I'm claiming it. One-third of that gold is mine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's fine, but - even a little London girl knows that one third of nothing is still nothing. There's a flicker of doubt in her eyes. She turns to Taro:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was he carrying anything? Taro holds up the BOND'S DIVING BELT, indicating 'nothing'. Angrily:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Search him. The men look at Bond - wearing only swim trunks. Nobody moves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do I have to do everything around here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope so. Frowning, Sidney moves to Bond. As she REACHES INTO HIS TRUNKS, we cut to THEIR FACES. THEIR EYES ARE LOCKED ON EACH OTHER:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope you'll be gentle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Think about mom. BOND WINCES. She's goosed him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Unusual technique. Returning to the WIDE SHOT, she opens the sack. SHOWS THE GOLD:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what do you call this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - The family jewels? She scowls, takes out the URANIUM TOOTH. Looks at it, blankly, and holds it out to a TECHNICIAN, who examines it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...I don't know. I'm not sure - Just then, a CREWMAN BURSTS IN:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boss! We got company - comin' up off the starboard bow!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bring them. Taro motions with his Uzi for Bond and Wade to follow... But BOND hesitates, LOOKING BACK AT THE TECHNICIAN with the URANIUM. 007 wants to get it, but Taro nudges him out with the gun muzzle. EXT. MALACCA STRAIT - DAY A BRITISH NAVAL CUTTER is pulling alongside the barge - SEA SIREN WAILING, crew members in battle gear, FORWARD GATLING GUN manned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Attention sea barge: Lay down your weapons, and prepare to be boarded. ON THE BARGE - Sidney and Co. stand, weapons ready.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Repeat: Lay down your weapons, and prepare to be boarded. Bond turns to Sidney, who's grabbed a bullhorn of her own.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I were you -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - You're not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just remember: They think there's ten billion dollars in gold down there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. (clicks it on, and:) "Now hear this: Drop dead." Bond and Wade exchange an amused/helpless glance - as if they both know what's coming next. There's a pause, then - THE CRUISER'S GATLING GUN ERUPTS WITH AN EARDRUM-SHATTERING SALVO. It's only a warning shot, but - EVERYONE ON THE BARGE DIVES FOR THE DECK... Except for Bond and Wade, who might as well be having tea. Bond looks down at Taro, cowering on the boards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gatling gun beats Uzi. NEW ANGLE - (CUTTER/BARGE) - DAY An ARMED BOARDING PARTY is coming across an aluminum bridge that has extended from the Cutter onto the barge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's in charge here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am. What do you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have precisely one minute to pull up your anchor and be under way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget it. No way. I got here first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's Wade?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That would be me -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks for your message. (turns to) And you're Bond?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guard! Arrest these men! Escort them to the cutter! Bond and Wade are stunned. The Marines move in. Bond struggles -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait a minute -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get them out of here. If he says one word, shoot him. As TWO MARINES with automatic rifles take Bond and Wade across the folding bridge -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's your name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain Morton. Pause. She expects him to ask "And yours?" but he doesn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My name is Sidney Winch, and -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good for you, Miss Winch. You now have exactly 30 seconds to get this rust bucket out of here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know my rights. These are international waters. The British Navy abandoned that boat, and I'm claiming it. Under international law, I have the right to salvage what's on that wreck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fifteen seconds. Perhaps you should consider hiring an attorney.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was an attorney!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmmm. I suppose this is a step above that profession. (beat) Ten seconds. Are you leaving?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You leave me no alternative.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cut her anchor. As Sidney yells "NO!" - THE FORWARD GATLING GUN erupts to life. One short, bone rattling burst CUTS THE CHAIN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You won't get away with this!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good-day, Miss Winch. I advise you to get some steam up - before you run aground. As she floats away, Sidney calls out to the Captain, Bond and Wade:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bastards! Believe me - you haven't heard the last of me! EXT. DECK - THE CUTTER - DAY - Bond, Wade and the Captain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Nice trick with the arrest. Very convincing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's no trick, Mr. Wade. I've got half a mind to throw both of you in the brig.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you think you're overreacting?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. The famous James Bond. I've heard all about you, sir. You were under direct orders to act as an observer - and yet you had to go off, on your own, like some half-assed CIA cowboy - (Wade reacts) Endangering the gold, attracting that lunatic woman, and then putting in a distress call for us to save your bloody hide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...That's all well and good, Captain, save for one thing: (beat) There's no gold down there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about? We went through all this and the ship isn't even down there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, the ship is down there. But the gold is gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's absurd! It took two squads of forty men fifteen days to load that gold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know what I saw -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care what you think you saw. You're a damned amateur. (beat) Just get off my ship. Go back to your trench-coats and your code names - and leave the job to professionals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aye-aye, Captain. EXT. SPORT FISHING BOAT - STRAIT OF MALACCA - DAY - As Bond and Wade push away from the Naval Cutter:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where to now, Jimbo?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not certain... But I think there's someone I want to press for some answers in Kuala Lumpur. EXT. COASTAL ROADWAY - MALAYSIA - (BOND CAR) - DAY - Bond'- car travels through the tropical landscape, turning at a sign for Kuala Lumpur. INT. BOND'S CAR - MOVING - COASTAL ROADWAY - DAY - As Bond downshifts in anticipation of an upcoming hill, his CAR PHONE RINGS. Before answering it, he looks down at: INSERT - DASHBOARD - DIGITAL DISPLAY PANEL - Displayed on separate lines:, "INCOMING CALL." "ORIGIN: (the display runs through numbers until it hits on) 763-4733." "NAME: (blinking) UNKNOWN. "STATUS: (blinking) SECURE." RETURN ON BOND - Reacting - the information is curious. Bond picks up the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bond.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Mister Bond.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is this? INT. HARMSWAY'S OUTER OFFICE - Harmsway is perched on a desk. In the background, THROUGH HIS OPEN OFFICE DOOR, we can see Harmsway's EXECUTIVE SECRETARY serving someone coffee from a SILVER TRAY - but we can't see who it is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elliot Harmsway! I heard you were in K.L. and thought we might get together for a chat... RETURN ON BOND - (INT. BOND'S CAR - MOVING) -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We seemed to get off on the wrong foot back there in Venice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did you get this number? INTERCUT AS NECESSARY:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, please, Mr. Bond. We live in the information age! Information is currency - and with the right currency, you can have any piece of information. (Bond reacts, sourly) Besides I own the phone company. What do you say? Twenty minutes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm on my way. Bond hangs up, and drives with renewed determination. INT. HARMSWAY'S OUTER OFFICE - Harmsway hangs up; STAMPER is standing nearby. Harmsway throws a concerned glance at his office, then turns to Stamper:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's find out exactly what he knows. EXT. KUALA LUMPUR - ROADWAY -(BOND CAR) - LATE AFTERNOON - Bond's car approaches the camera, passes it, and heads for HARMSWAY TOWERS, looming over Kuala Lumpur in the distance. EXT. HARMSWAY TOWERS - STREET LEVEL - LATE AFTERNOON - Bond's car passes the front of the building, and drives down a ramp into an underground car park. INT. UNDERGROUND CAR PARK - (HARMSWAY TOWERS) - Passing NEWSPAPER LOADING DOCKS (with trucks displaying both the "TOMORROW" and "HNN" logos, and HUM-VEES used by building security,) Bond pulls into the VALET AREA - Where a cheerful YOUNG PR WOMAN and VALET wait. Both wear the colorful BLAZER used by all Harmsway Building service personnel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: James Bond to see Elliot Harmsway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. I'm to bring you right up. The valet will take your car -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd prefer to park it myself. (off her questioning look) Temperamental. Practically has a mind of its own.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't they all? She points to a spot near the loading docks. Bond drives off. INT. BOND'S CAR - Bond backs into the space, thinking about the (inevitable) quick get- away. He looks through the windshield, surveying the area. BOND'S POV - UNDERGROUND CAR PARK - TWO BURLY SECURITY GUARDS (in Harmsway Blazers,) stand behind a bulletproof security desk. There's a METAL DETECTOR by the door. BACK TO SCENE (INT. BOND'S CAR) - Reaching inside his jacket, Bond REMOVES HIS GUN, and HIDES IT in a compartment under the dashboard. INT. UNDERGROUND CAR PARK - The PR WOMAN joins Bond as he locks the car with the REMOTE CONTROL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right this way. Following her through the metal detector, Bond scans the security devices at the guard's desk: Lots of cameras, sensors, and alarms. EXT. PRESSROOM OBSERVATION ARCADE - Bond and the PR Woman step off an escalator onto an open arcade with GLASS WINDOWS looking down into a mammoth NEWSPAPER PRINTING PLANT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Harmsway is checking the afternoon editions. If you'll just follow me - INT. PRESSROOM BALCONY - The NOISE FROM THE PRINTING PRESSES is deafening. Bond and the PR WOMAN walk down a METAL STAIRCASE to the pressroom floor, where - Harmsway (wearing a printer's smock and newsprint cap,) is joking with SEVERAL PRESSMEN - a fresh issue of "Tomorrow" outstretched in his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Bond! Nice to see you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir Elliot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come. Let's get out of the noise. (escorting Bond off) - I'll give you a tour of the building, then we'll talk. INT. DRESSING ALCOVE - OFF THE PRESSROOM - Harmsway is hanging up his smock in the short hallway that leads from the press room to an elevator. There's a SINK in the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's funny, Mr. Bond. Of all the things I own, nothing gives me as much enjoyment as my newspapers. He moves to the sink to wash his hands. Turns on the faucets:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ironic, isn't it? In the age of TV, I still can't get the ink out of my veins. Bond SMILES WRYLY, looking at Harmsway hunched over the sink:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes... A man with ink in his veins, and blood on his hands. Harmsway smiles to himself, acknowledging the jibe... But decides to ignore it. He turns off the faucet, dries his hands -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We print 31 newspapers here; another two-hundred-and-seventy at satellite plants around the world. He pulls on his 2000 Saville Row suit-jacket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... And how many of those newspapers carried Paris Harmsway's obituary? Harmsway turns, and presses the ELEVATOR BUTTON. The doors open, instantly. HE SMILES:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All of them, Mister Bond... (motioning inside) After you? INT. ELEVATOR - The doors close. Bond clocks the security camera in the ceiling. Harmsway is about to take great delight in making Bond squirm:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before I became involved with Paris, she was always involved with the most inappropriate' men... (beat) Playboys. Thrill seekers. Middle aged Peter Pans who only brought out the worst in her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I tried to save her. But she remained a manic depressive: Fits, inappropriate behavior... Delusions of grandeur.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wonder if it runs in the family.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The only difference between a psychopath and a genius, Mr. Bond, is the degree of success. He looks up at the digital readout, going from 40 to 50.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still, I do miss her. I only wish she could have lived to see all this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can feel your pain. The doors open:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By the way - what is it that brings you to Kuala Lumpur, Mister Bond?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sightseeing. Harmsway motions for Bond to exit. They step out into: INT. ELEGANT HALLWAY ("ROGUES GALLERY") - LATE AFTERNOON A short hallway lined with OIL PORTRAITS of Harmsway's ancestors. Double doors at both ends. (People passing through.) As they walk -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I call this the Rogue's gallery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. I can see: You've hung the rest of your relatives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My third great Uncle - the Earl of Aberdeen - negotiated the purchase of Hong Kong from the Chinese. (moving to) His son-in-law - George Harmsway - made the first family fortune, running opium into Shanghai... (moving to) His son, Thomas, who lost it, smoking the opium... And my grandfather Henry, who opened the first telegraph station, and published the colony's first English newspaper. (pausing, wistfully) It was a city of unlimited possibility.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So why did you leave?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because it's a dying city. Since the Chinese take-over, who knows what can happen tomorrow? (moving to the last two portraits) In any case, this is my father, Charles: A royal bastard who started the first radio and television stations. Said I'd never amount to anything, but... (passing his own portrait) I turned it into this He pushes through a door, into: INT. HNN NEWS CENTER - LATE AFTERNOON - A cavernous THREE STORY ROOM bristling with activity. At the center is the main HNN ANCHOR DESK, (where a news broadcast is in progress,) surrounded by scores of reporter's desks a la CNN. Around the perimeter of the room are VARIOUS TV STUDIOS looking out on Kuala Lumpur. All are broadcasting: A Larry King-type chat show; MTV; SPORTS; a KITCHEN where a chef is preparing something flambeed. With its walls of monitors, equipment, and control rooms, the effect is overwhelming. Harmsway will walk Bond around the perimeter:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Welcome to the new world order, Mr. Bond. (starting to walk) Churchill had his armies; Caesar had his legions; I have my divisions: (pointing) News, sports, business, entertainment. And these are my foot soldiers: (a wave of his hand)
direction.name: direction

result.heading: SEES THE CABLE GROW TAUT AROUND THE VENTILATION SHAFT
COMPUTER GENERATED MAP OF THE SEA FLOOR,
THE FACE OF A FLOATING DEAD SAILOR
SLIPS THE GOLD BAR INTO A WEBBED SACK ON HIS BELT,
THEIR EYES ARE LOCKED ON EACH OTHER
THE CRUISER'S GATLING GUN ERUPTS WITH AN EARDRUM-SHATTERING SALVO
EVERYONE ON THE BARGE DIVES FOR THE DECK

direction.raw_text: people working on 14 floors to feed
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: newspapers, 4 cable news networks, 87 magazines, and 29 different cable TV channels - in 35 languages.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And still not a thing to watch. He glances at the SATELLITE CONTROL ROOM, with a NASA-type WORLD MAP.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Although it must be fun to have all those satellites.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're merely tools to disseminate information.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or disinformation... If you wanted to, say, beam down a signal to send a ship off course? Maybe one degree a minute?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fantastic idea Mr. Bond! Perhaps I should buy it for a book! It's totally preposterous, but - (off Bond's reaction) You amuse me. ...And now perhaps I can amuse you. He stops at a VIDEO TERMINAL. Begins to type.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's see... First we have this James Bond... I believe he's a field adjuster for Lloyd's of London... INSERT VIDEO SCREEN - BOND'S MI-6 COVER -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then we have this James Bond. INSERT VIDEO SCREEN - BOND'S KGB FILE -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Licensed to Kill... (aside) Not a bad title for that book... (then) Or perhaps you'd prefer this James Bond - INSERT VIDEO SCREEN - BOND'S CHINESE FILE -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who I believe they call "007." Bond is not amused. Harmsway is enjoying himself:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You see, Mr. Bond, you and I are both men of action. But your era is passing. Words are the new weapons; satellites the new artillery. And make no mistake about it: In the right hands, they can be as deadly as your Walther PPK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Words to live by?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your choice. (glancing at his watch) Look at the time! Come. There's someone I want you meet - about a story I'm thinking of publishing. As they leave, Bond is frustrated by Harmsway's "I don't care what you think you know - I can crush you" attitude... And now, Harmsway plans (and the operative word here is plans,) to use Bond, to tie off the one other loose thread in his perfect crime: INT. HARMSWAY'S OFFICE - The DOOR opens and Harmsway enters, followed by Bond. He calls to someone we don't see:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, dear. I'm sorry I took so long - REVEAL: SIDNEY is sitting across from his desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's okay, Uncle Ell - She freezes in mid-sentence, seeing Bond. Bond is equally surprised.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is HE doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see you two have met.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Briefly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't pout, Sidney. I invited him here hoping he might shed some light on your story. He's from 'Lloyd's of London.' (sly glance to Bond) ...Aren't you, Mr. Bond?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not going to tell the truth! He was diving for the gold! Harmsway sits, and addresses Bond, matter-of-factly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It seems - Mr. Bond - that Miss Winch has told me the most incredible story: A sunken British warship filled with gold; a British cutter firing on her; billions of dollars in bullion lying on the bottom of the Strait. Bond isn't enjoying this charade.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Obviously, the British government denies all of this -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - I told you! He was there! -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - But as I've explained to Sidney, without proof, there's just no story. Don't you agree Mr. Bond? Before Bond can answer -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I have proof! You ran out of here so fast, I didn't get to show you. Bond and Harmsway react - with entirely different concerns: Harmsway wasn't expecting her to have proof; Bond knows that if she shows him the gold, (or worse, the uranium tooth,) Harmsway will probably kill both of them to destroy the evidence, and witnesses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...And what's that, my dear?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sidney, perhaps we should leave this to - Sidney cuts Bond off, DROPPING THE GOLD BAR on Harmsway's desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He brought that up from the wreck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...I see. Alarmed, Bond wants to stop Sidney from reaching into her bag again -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sidney, I wouldn't - Too late. She drops the uranium tooth on his desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what about this? Any idea what this is? Silence. Harmsway and Bond exchange a sober look. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... I believe it's a depleted uranium drill bit, my dear. HE PRESSES AN ALARM UNDER HIS DESK. Bond reaches for the DRILL TOOTH.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't we just take these -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I want Sir Elliot to keep them. Harmsway stands, comes around the desk:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Well! I do believe this requires further investigation!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, Uncle Elliot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No matter what the British government says, I won't kill this story. (his secretary appears in the doorway) Miss Oxford will show both of you to the elevator... And one of my people will definitely be in touch sooner than later.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure they will.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good-bye, Mister Bond. He reaches to kiss Sidney - and looks in her eyes a second too long.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good-bye, darling. Watching them exit, his smile turns hard and bitter. INT. ELEVATOR HALLWAY - DAY - As the Executive Secretary escorts them to the elevator, Bond glances out the PICTURE WINDOW, with its view of the other tower.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you both for coming in... BOND'S POV - EXT. HARMSWAY TOWERS - Five floors directly down is the GLASS-ENCLOSED SKY BRIDGE; just above him, he sees TWO WINDOW WASHERS being pulled up on a TWO MAN SCAFFOLD. BACK TO SCENE - A CHIME SOUNDS; the elevator doors open. Bond and Sidney ad-lib good-byes to the secretary and get in. INT. ELEVATOR - DAY Sidney presses the button for "1". Bond glances at the FLOOR INDI- CATOR with reads "55" - clocks the SECURITY CAMERA - and starts looking for an ESCAPE PANEL. Sidney watches out of the corner of her eye, thinking he's nuts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Do you have a gun?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You heard me. A gun? (disabling it) I left mine in the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's funny: you struck me as the kind of man who always carries protection.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen to me! I'm a British secret service agent. And we have about two minutes before Harmsway kills both of us. He glances up at the escape panel at the rear of the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Has anyone ever suggested that you're a paranoid psychotic? Bond ignores the insult, explaining as he moves under the panel:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harmsway sank that ship and stole the gold. It's on the Sea Dolphin II. (boosting himself up) And thanks to your little show and tell - (straining to open the panel) - giving him the evidence - (popping it open) We're the only ones who can tie him to the crime.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elliot Harmsway is my Uncle!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blood or Dutch?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was my father's best friend!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's killed closer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are seriously deranged.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe. But why are we going up instead of down? He nods to the FLOOR INDICATOR. She looks: 60, 65, 70. IT STOPS. Bond reaches down to her -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sidney, come with me - THE DOORS OPEN. She looks at his outstretched hand with disdain:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not if my life depended on it. INT. 70TH FLOOR -- DAY Sidney comes out onto a floor still under construction. The elevator doors CLOSE behind her. To the right, she sees STAMPER and a Harmsway-blazered GUARD, with MACHINE PISTOLS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank God! He's crazy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does he have a gun?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. On Stamper's reply -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good - He lunges for her, grabs her, spins her around, overwhelming her. She struggles, yelling:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a mistake!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up! Using Sidney as a HUMAN SHIELD, Stamper marches her in front of the closed elevator doors. The guard follows. THEY POSITION THEMSELVES FOR A MASSACRE. Reaching around Sidney, Stamper pulls out his RADIO:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Open 14. A beat. It opens. The men unleash a HAIL OF BULLETS, then realize - NEW ANGLE - (INT. ELEVATOR) - The car is empty. Stamper perplexed. Pushing Sidney in front of him, he enters the elevator, cautiously... When, suddenly: BOND SWINGS DOWN OUT OF THE ESCAPE PANEL (like an athlete on a high- bar) FEET FIRST - barely clearing Sidney's head as he KICKS Stamper and the Guard in their faces. They go flying backwards. Bond jumps down, grabs Sidney -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Need a lift? And boosts her into the escape panel, following her up. INT. ELEVATOR SHAFT - ABOVE THE ELEVATOR - (CONTINUOUS) - Bond and Sidney rush forward to the front wall as - STAMPER AND THE GUARD - Recover, grab their guns, move to the threshold, and START RAKING THE CEILING WITH GUNFIRE. ELEVATOR SHAFT - Bond presses his body against Sidney, on the front wall, trying to SHIELD HER as BULLETS RIP UP THE FLOOR behind them. With his free hand, Bond reaches up for the LATCH to open the door above them. INT. ELEVATOR - Stamper stops shooting. Moves to the rear of the cab, under the escape panel. Peers up. Sees nothing. Turns to the Guard:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help me up. ELEVATOR SHAFT - Stamper's head pokes up through the hole just as Bond and Sidney have disappeared into - INT. HALLWAY - (ELEVATOR BANK) - 71ST FLOOR. Squeezing out from between the elevator doors, (which immediately close behind them,) Bond and Sidney encounter a group of STUNNED OFFICE WORKERS, waiting for the elevator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... I'd try the stairs. As Bond and Sidney scamper off - RETURN ON STAMPER - IN THE ELEVATOR -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The stairs! (barking into his RADIO) Attention all units! They're on the
direction.name: direction

result.heading: HE PRESSES AN ALARM UNDER HIS DESK
THEY POSITION THEMSELVES FOR A MASSACRE
START RAKING THE CEILING WITH GUNFIRE
